title: CVPR_2009_18_abs

sentences.text: We present a new method for detecting interest points using histogram information .

Unlike existing interest point detectors , which measure pixel-wise differences in image intensity , our detectors incorporate histogram-based representations , and thus can find image regions that present a distinct distribution in the neighborhood .
The proposed detectors are able to capture large-scale structures and distinctive textured patterns , and exhibit strong invariance to rotation , illumination variation , and blur .

The experimental results show that the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors perform particularly well for the tasks of matching textured scenes under blur and illumination changes , in terms of repeatability and distinctiveness .
An extension of our method to space-time interest point detection for action classification is also presented .

Entity-the_proposed_histogram-based_inte.label: the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors
aliases: the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors
Entity-the_proposed_histogram-based_inte.description: The proposed histogram-based interest point detectors are a novel algorithm designed to identify interest points in images by utilizing histogram information, allowing for effective detection of large-scale structures and textured patterns while maintaining robustness against variations in rotation, illumination, and blur.

Entity-our_detector.label: our detectors
Entity-our_detector.description: Our detectors refer to a novel type of interest point detectors that utilize histogram-based representations to identify image regions with distinct distributions, offering advantages in capturing large-scale structures and textured patterns while maintaining invariance to rotation, illumination changes, and blur.

Entity-detecting_interest_point.label: detecting interest points
Entity-detecting_interest_point.description: Detecting interest points refers to the task of identifying specific regions in an image that exhibit distinct characteristics, utilizing histogram-based representations to enhance the detection of large-scale structures and textured patterns, while maintaining robustness against variations in rotation, illumination, and blur.

Entity-a_new_method.label: a new method
Entity-a_new_method.description: The new method refers to a histogram-based approach for detecting interest points in images, which improves upon traditional pixel-wise intensity difference methods by utilizing histogram representations to identify distinct distributions in image regions.

Entity-detector.label: detectors
Entity-detector.description: The term 'detectors' refers to a novel type of interest point detection algorithm that utilizes histogram-based representations to identify image regions with distinct distributions, enhancing performance in recognizing large-scale structures and textured patterns under varying conditions.

Entity-a_new_method_for_detecting_intere.label: a new method for detecting interest points
aliases: a new method for detecting interest points
Entity-a_new_method_for_detecting_intere.description: The entity 'a new method for detecting interest points' refers to a novel approach that utilizes histogram information to identify interest points in images, distinguishing itself from traditional methods by focusing on histogram-based representations to capture large-scale structures and textured patterns with strong invariance to various image transformations.

mentions.local_name: a new method for detecting interest points

Entity-distinctive_textured_pattern.label: distinctive textured patterns
Entity-distinctive_textured_pattern.description: Distinctive textured patterns refer to unique surface characteristics in images that can be effectively identified and analyzed by the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors, which are designed to recognize variations in texture and structure while maintaining robustness against changes in rotation, illumination, and blur.

Entity-textured_pattern.label: textured patterns
Entity-textured_pattern.description: Textured patterns refer to distinctive visual features in images that exhibit unique distributions in their neighborhood, which can be effectively captured by the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors.

Entity-existing_interest_point_detector.label: existing interest point detectors
Entity-existing_interest_point_detector.description: Existing interest point detectors are algorithms that identify key points in images by analyzing pixel-wise differences in image intensity, but do not utilize histogram-based representations to capture distinct distributions in the neighborhood.

Entity-method.label: method
Entity-method.description: The method refers to a novel technique for detecting interest points in images by utilizing histogram information, which allows for the identification of regions with distinct distributions, enhancing performance in various conditions such as rotation and illumination changes.

Entity-matching_textured_scene_under_blu.label: matching textured scenes under blur and illumination changes
aliases: matching textured scenes under blur and illumination changes
Entity-matching_textured_scene_under_blu.description: Matching textured scenes under blur and illumination changes refers to the task of accurately identifying and correlating regions in images that exhibit distinct textures, despite variations in blur and lighting conditions, utilizing advanced histogram-based interest point detection methods.

mentions.local_name: matching textured scenes under blur and illumination changes

Entity-textured_scene.label: textured scenes
Entity-textured_scene.description: Textured scenes refer to image regions characterized by distinct patterns and structures that can be effectively matched and analyzed using histogram-based interest point detection methods, particularly under varying conditions such as blur and illumination changes.

Entity-histogram_information.label: histogram information
Entity-histogram_information.description: Histogram information refers to the statistical representation of pixel intensity distributions in images, which is utilized in the proposed method for detecting interest points by identifying distinct patterns and structures in the neighborhood of image regions.

Entity-repeatability_and_distinctiveness.label: repeatability and distinctiveness
Entity-repeatability_and_distinctiveness.description: Repeatability and distinctiveness refer to the performance metrics of the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors, indicating their effectiveness in consistently identifying and distinguishing textured regions in images despite variations in blur and illumination.

Entity-matching_textured_scene.label: matching textured scenes
Entity-matching_textured_scene.description: Matching textured scenes refers to the task of identifying and aligning image regions with similar texture patterns, particularly under varying conditions such as blur and changes in illumination, using histogram-based interest point detection methods.

Entity-interest_point_detector.label: interest point detectors
Entity-interest_point_detector.description: Interest point detectors are algorithms or tools used in computer vision and image processing to identify specific points in an image that are considered to be of interest, often based on variations in intensity or other features.

Entity-interest_point.label: interest points
Entity-interest_point.description: Interest points refer to specific locations in an image that are identified as significant features based on histogram information, allowing for robust detection of distinct image regions and patterns, particularly in the context of image processing and feature extraction.

Entity-distinctiveness.label: distinctiveness
Entity-distinctiveness.description: Distinctiveness refers to a performance metric used to evaluate the effectiveness of histogram-based interest point detectors in identifying and matching textured scenes, particularly under varying conditions such as blur and illumination changes.

Entity-blur_and_illumination_change.label: blur and illumination changes
Entity-blur_and_illumination_change.description: Blur and illumination changes refer to variations in image quality and lighting conditions that affect the appearance of textured scenes, which the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors are designed to handle effectively.

Entity-an_extension_of_our_method.label: An extension of our method
Entity-an_extension_of_our_method.description: An extension of our method refers to the adaptation of the proposed histogram-based interest point detection technique for the specific application of space-time interest point detection aimed at action classification.

Entity-distinct_distribution_in_the_neig.label: distinct distribution in the neighborhood
Entity-distinct_distribution_in_the_neig.description: The term 'distinct distribution in the neighborhood' refers to the unique arrangement of pixel intensity values within a local area of an image, as identified by histogram-based representations in a method for detecting interest points.

Entity-strong_invariance_to_rotation.label: strong invariance to rotation
Entity-strong_invariance_to_rotation.description: Strong invariance to rotation refers to the ability of the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors to consistently identify and match image features regardless of the orientation of the image, thereby enhancing their robustness against changes in viewpoint.

Entity-histogram-based_representation.label: histogram-based representations
Entity-histogram-based_representation.description: Histogram-based representations are data structures that summarize the distribution of data points or pixel intensities in a dataset, often used in image processing to capture the frequency of different intensity values within specified intervals.

Entity-space-time_interest_point_detecti.label: space-time interest point detection
Entity-space-time_interest_point_detecti.description: Space-time interest point detection is a computer vision technique used to identify significant points in a video that capture important spatial and temporal information, facilitating the analysis and classification of actions.

Entity-distribution.label: distribution
Entity-distribution.description: In this context, 'distribution' refers to the statistical representation of pixel intensity values in image regions, which is used to identify distinct areas in the neighborhood for interest point detection.

Entity-illumination_change.label: illumination changes
Entity-illumination_change.description: Illumination changes refer to variations in lighting conditions that affect the appearance of textured scenes, impacting the performance of interest point detectors in image processing.

Entity-pixel-wise_difference_in_image_in.label: pixel-wise differences in image intensity
Entity-pixel-wise_difference_in_image_in.description: Pixel-wise differences in image intensity refer to the variations in brightness values between corresponding pixels in an image, which are commonly used in image processing to identify features and detect interest points.

Entity-blur.label: blur
Entity-blur.description: In the context of image processing, 'blur' refers to a visual effect that results in a loss of sharpness and detail in images, often caused by factors such as motion or out-of-focus conditions, which the proposed interest point detectors are designed to handle effectively.

Entity-rotation.label: rotation
Entity-rotation.description: In this context, 'rotation' refers to the geometric transformation property that allows the proposed interest point detectors to maintain their performance and accuracy despite changes in the orientation of the image.

Entity-neighborhood.label: neighborhood
Entity-neighborhood.description: In this context, 'neighborhood' refers to the local area or region in an image where distinct histogram-based distributions are identified for the purpose of detecting interest points.

Entity-illumination_variation.label: illumination variation
Entity-illumination_variation.description: Illumination variation refers to the changes in lighting conditions that affect the appearance of images, which can impact the performance of image processing techniques, particularly in detecting interest points.

Entity-image_intensity.label: image intensity
Entity-image_intensity.description: Image intensity refers to the brightness or darkness of a pixel in an image, representing the amount of light captured at that point.

Entity-image_region.label: image regions
Entity-image_region.description: Image regions refer to specific areas or segments within an image that can be analyzed or processed for various purposes, such as identifying features or patterns.

Entity-action_classification.label: action classification
Entity-action_classification.description: Action classification is a task in machine learning and computer vision that involves identifying and categorizing actions or activities from visual data, such as video sequences.

Entity-large-scale_structure.label: large-scale structures
Entity-large-scale_structure.description: Large-scale structures refer to significant and extensive formations or patterns that can be identified in various contexts, such as in images or physical environments, often characterized by their size and complexity.

Entity-repeatability.label: repeatability
Entity-repeatability.description: Repeatability refers to the ability of a measurement or experimental result to be consistently reproduced under the same conditions, often used as an evaluation criterion or performance metric in various scientific and engineering contexts.

Entity-experimental_result.label: experimental results
Entity-experimental_result.description: Experimental results refer to the data and findings obtained from conducting experiments, which provide evidence to support or refute hypotheses in research.

summary: We present a new method for detecting interest points using histogram information . Unlike existing interest point detectors , which measure pixel-wise differences in image intensity , our detectors incorporate histogram-based representations , and thus can find image regions that present a distinct distribution in the neighborhood . The proposed detectors are able to capture large-scale structures and distinctive textured patterns , and exhibit strong invariance to rotation , illumination variation , and blur . The experimental results show that the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors perform particularly well for the tasks of matching textured scenes under blur and illumination changes , in terms of repeatability and distinctiveness . An extension of our method to space-time interest point detection for action classification is also presented .

Predicate-is_for.label: is for
Predicate-is_for.description: The predicate 'is for' establishes a purpose or intended use relationship between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject is designed, created, or intended to achieve the goal or function represented by the object.

Predicate-uses.label: uses

It signifies that the subject actively incorporates the object into its process or methodology, highlighting the role of the object as a tool, resource, or component that facilitates the actions or objectives of the subject.

This relationship highlights the capability of the subject to recognize or ascertain the existence of the object.

Predicate-presents.label: presents

It establishes a relationship where the subject serves as a source of information or a proposal regarding the object.

Predicate-can_find.label: can find

skos:broader.label: has a broader term

This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider range of concepts or entities than the subject, thereby situating the subject within a broader context.
